title: Autobiography of Mrs. Fletcher.
author: Fletcher
snippet: We had then (June, 1804) removed from Queen Street to No. 51 North Castle Street, for the sake of additional house-room,' and a larger back green as a playground for the children.

title: Autobiography of Mrs. Fletcher.
author: Fletcher
snippet: James Grahame, the gentle poet of " The Sabbath," and " The Birds of Scotland," was so susceptible of the tender passion that he fell in love at first sight with a young lady whom he saw first ringing at our door, then No. 20 Queen Street.

title: Autobiography of Mrs. Fletcher.
author: Fletcher
snippet: In the spring of 1794 my father made us a present of an excellent house in Queen Street, No. 20, and came down himself in the summer with my aunt and Mrs. Brudenell to spend a month or two with us.
